closed_reason: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and identified 4 subcommands: (1) run [epic-id] - runs an epic with AI agent, (2) resume <checkpoint-id> - resumes from a checkpoint, (3) checkpoints [epic-id] - lists available checkpoints, (4) upgrade - upgrades ticker to latest version. The root command 'ticker' is also defined.
description: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and list all subcommands defined.

run.output:
I'll start by reading the main.go file to find all CLI subcommands defined.

I've read the file. Now I'll close the task with a summary of the CLI commands found.

Task completed. Here's a summary of the CLI commands defined in `cmd/ticker/main.go`:

**Root command**: `ticker` - Autonomous AI agent loop runner

**Subcommands**:
1. **`run [epic-id]`** - Run an epic with the AI agent. Flags: `--max-iterations`, `--max-cost`, `--checkpoint-interval`, `--max-task-retries`, `--auto`, `--headless`
2. **`resume <checkpoint-id>`** - Resume from a saved checkpoint
3. **`checkpoints [epic-id]`** - List available checkpoints, optionally filtered by epic
4. **`upgrade`** - Download and install the latest version of ticker

title: List CLI commands
